title: The Sealing and the Multitude
shortSummary: Revelation chapter 7 reveals a pause in the divine judgments to seal 144,000 servants of God from the tribes of Israel, symbolizing God's protection over His people. It then presents a great multitude from every nation standing before the throne, clothed in white robes, signifying the redeemed who have come through tribulation and now serve God eternally.
timeline: c. AD 95 - The Apostle John's vision on the island of Patmos during the early Christian persecution

keyCharacters.name: Four Angels
keyCharacters.description: Angelic beings who hold back the four winds to prevent destruction until God's servants are sealed.

keyCharacters.name: Angel with the Seal
keyCharacters.description: An angel ascending from the east who commands the sealing of God's servants to protect them from coming judgments.

keyCharacters.name: The Elders
keyCharacters.description: Heavenly beings who provide explanation about the great multitude arrayed in white robes.

keyCharacters.name: The Lamb
keyCharacters.description: Jesus Christ, who stands at the center of the throne, whose blood cleanses and redeems the saints.

definitions.definition: A mark of ownership and protection placed on God's servants, signifying divine ownership and preservation.
A symbolic number representing a complete, purified group of God's servants from the twelve tribes of Israel.
A period of intense suffering and persecution experienced by believers before final deliverance.
Branches held as a symbol of victory and celebration, often associated with worship and triumph.

outline.heading: The Four Angels and the Sealing Command
outline.description: Four angels hold back the winds of destruction until another angel seals the servants of God, emphasizing God's sovereign control over judgment and His protection of His people.

outline.heading: The Sealing of the 144,000 from Israel
outline.description: A specific number of 144,000 from the twelve tribes of Israel are sealed, symbolizing God's faithful preservation of His covenant people amid coming trials.

outline.heading: The Great Multitude in White Robes
outline.description: John sees a vast, uncountable multitude from every nation worshiping God and the Lamb, illustrating the universal scope of salvation.

outline.heading: The Identity and Blessings of the Redeemed
outline.description: An elder explains that the white-robed multitude are those who have come out of great tribulation, now serving God eternally and enjoying His provision and comfort.

application: Trust in God's sovereign protection during times of trial, knowing He marks and preserves His own.
Recognize the universal call of the gospel that includes people from every nation and language.
Live with assurance that faithfulness through tribulation leads to eternal reward and service before God.
Worship God continually, joining the heavenly multitude in praise and thanksgiving.

keyVerses.text: Saying, Hurt not the earth, neither the sea, nor the trees, till we have sealed the servants of our God in their foreheads.
keyVerses.significance: This verse highlights God's mercy and protection over His people before judgment proceeds.

keyVerses.text: And I heard the number of them which were sealed: and there were sealed an hundred and forty and four thousand of all the tribes of the children of Israel.
keyVerses.significance: It emphasizes the completeness and divine selection of God's faithful servants.

keyVerses.text: After this I beheld, and, lo, a great multitude, which no man could number, of all nations, and kindreds, and people, and tongues, stood before the throne, and before the Lamb, clothed with white robes, and palms in their hands;
keyVerses.significance: This verse reveals the vast, diverse company of redeemed believers worshiping God.

keyVerses.text: For the Lamb which is in the midst of the throne shall feed them, and shall lead them unto living fountains of waters: and God shall wipe away all tears from their eyes.
keyVerses.significance: It offers a powerful promise of eternal comfort and provision from Christ for His people.
